275d126c-fcac-4656-bfb9-d2d3f3ddaf2c.description: The earner of this badge graduated from the Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course and successfully completed the requirements to serve as an AIB Recorder. The earner has advanced knowledge and understanding of the duties and responsibilities of the board; roles of the MAJCOM legal office, legal advisor, and paralegal/recorder; and, how to conduct the investigation, witness interviews, drafting reports, and safety privilege.
275d126c-fcac-4656-bfb9-d2d3f3ddaf2c.name: Operations & International Law: (G)AIB Recorder Specialist

alignments.name: Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course
alignments.description: This course instructs judge advocates and paralegals on how to conduct accident investigations IAW AFI 51-307, Aerospace and Ground Accident Investigations. The course is for judge advocates and paralegals that are selected to be legal advisors and recorders for accident investigation boards (AIB) and ground accident investigation boards (GAIB).

badge_template_activities.title: Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course (see link below)
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

c19a7b7e-82b9-4e48-be09-f1dae0f6bcff.description: The earner of this badge is able to employ emotional intelligence skills in their professional and interpersonal relationships by managing their emotions more effectively, including recognizing and dismissing unproductive emotions when necessary, understanding how emotions affect themselves and those around them, identifying their emotional state and that of others, and using social skills to manage conversations, interactions, and relationships.
c19a7b7e-82b9-4e48-be09-f1dae0f6bcff.name: Paralegal: Emotional Intelligence Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Complete The Ultimate Emotional Intelligence Training Program
Complete an Emotional Intelligence self-assessment
Complete the Paralegal: Emotional Intelligence Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

70ed24f9-b3c8-4845-9de0-6879db997659.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to receipt for a claim, determine jurisdiction of a claim, determine the settlement authority of a claim, investigate a claim, utilize common tools to conduct legal research, draft correspondence documents, draft review documents, manage cases utilizing a web-based data management system and collaborate with appropriate agencies for processing a claim.
70ed24f9-b3c8-4845-9de0-6879db997659.name: Civil Law: Claims Processing Specialist

alignments.name: Claims Service Center Action Officer Handbook
alignments.description: A collection of resources, checklists and guidance for processing various claims.

alignments.name: AFI 51-306, Administrative Claims for and Against the Air Force
alignments.description: This publication describes investigation, adjudication, and settlement of certain claims.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the online Claims Training 101 course (NOTE: JAG KM site is CAC enabled)
Process five claims (i.e., Military Claims Act (MCA), Federal Tort Claims Act (FTCA), Foreign Claims Act (FCA), Non-Combat Activity (NCA), etc.)
Complete the Civil Law: Claims Processing Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

83812a46-a09b-47a3-a6ba-f00e52321392.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to evaluate documents, evidence requests, and productions. They are able to understand rules of evidence and document management techniques to meet their technical competence and ethical mandate.
83812a46-a09b-47a3-a6ba-f00e52321392.name: Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Complete one of three options that demonstrate the ability to evaluate documents, evidence requests, and productions

Option 1: Work a minimum of 5 discovery requests and provide an essay detailing the experience. The essay will include a summary of a discovery response and/or discovery request, type of offense(s), outside agency coordination (if applicable), a description of the type of evidence, the information solicited to fulfill the discovery response and/or discovery request, and a description of the discovery or evidence tracking tool utilized.

Option 2: Complete a 3-credit hour, college-level evidence or discovery course (with transcript verification) and submit an essay outlining the experience and technical knowledge gained from the course (an example of a course that meets this requirement is LAW 6930, Electronic Discovery, Digital Investigations, and Evidence at Levin College of Law)

Option 3: Read and review applicable chapters from the Federal Rules of Evidence and Military Rules of Evidence and write an essay that includes applicable citations for at least 10 rules related to discovery procedures and rules of evidence. Additionally, the Earner will describe a discovery or evidence management tool with an explanation of its use.
Complete the Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

e78c7010-5145-417b-ad3f-d2a4e5b6924f.description: The earner of this badge graduated from the Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course, performed the duties of a (G)AIB Recorder by providing operational legal support with a vast awareness of the emergency response environment, contributing to legal counsel, conducting witness interviews, briefings, and draft reports with full structural knowledge of the authorities, regulations, privileges, and guidance governing the investigation process.
e78c7010-5145-417b-ad3f-d2a4e5b6924f.name: Operations & International Law: (G)AIB Recorder Manager

alignments.name: Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course
alignments.description: This course instructs judge advocates and paralegals on how to conduct accident investigations IAW AFI 51-307, Aerospace and Ground Accident Investigations. The course is for judge advocates and paralegals that are selected to be legal advisors and recorders for accident investigation boards (AIB) and ground accident investigation boards (GAIB).

alignments.name: Aircraft Investigation Recorder Guide
alignments.description: Provides guidance to draft a publicly releasable report of facts and circumstances surrounding an aircraft or ground accident.

badge_template_activities.title: Air Force Judge Advocate General's School Accident Investigation Board (AIB) Course (see link below)
Perform the duties of a (G)AIB Recorder
Draft (G)AIB Report

Complete a professional journal documenting the team/individual contributions to the (G)AIB, stating the  knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs) utilized during the investigation, with examples of personal/professional growth
Complete the Operations & International Law: (G)AIB Recorder Manager rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

3bd67cd8-9269-4af2-895d-cfff8352aeb6.description: The Earner of this badge graduated from an Operations Law course and has knowledge and understanding of the duties of an Operations Law Paralegal in a variety of environments that enhance command situational awareness, maximize decision space, and promote optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.
3bd67cd8-9269-4af2-895d-cfff8352aeb6.name: Operations & International Law: Operations Specialist

alignments.name: AFJAGS Operations Law Course
alignments.description: This course provides judge advocates and paralegals with an introduction to the fundamentals of operations and international law; trains students to identify and analyze legal and political implications of military operations; and, application of legal principles to operational problems in support of military operations CONUS and OCONUS.

alignments.name: AFJAGS Homeland Defense / Homeland Security
alignments.description: The objective of the Homeland Defense / Homeland Security course is to provide judge advocates, civilian attorneys, and paralegals with basic instruction on the law applicable to domestic operations, including homeland defense, homeland security, and defense support of civilian law enforcement authorities.

alignments.name: JKO Legal Authorities in Support of Joint Operations
alignments.description: The purpose of this course is to familiarize students with legal issues and challenges that affect the Joint Task Force Headquarters, with an understanding of how authorities undergird unified action; the concept and use of Rules of Engagement; and the key legal issues involved in stability operations.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduate from an Operations Law course (recommended courses listed below)
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

4ad5257f-8d08-4d59-a2f9-8d66d751652c.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the fundamental skills of written and verbal communication by expressing thoughts and providing directions for individuals and groups via multiple platforms such as email, virtual meetings, social media, and public speaking.
4ad5257f-8d08-4d59-a2f9-8d66d751652c.name: Paralegal: Communication Specialist

alignments.name: AF Handbook 33-337 USAF Tongue and Quill
alignments.description: The Tongue and Quill has been a valued Air Force resource for decades and many Airmen from our Total Force of uniformed and civilian members have contributed their talents to various editions over the years.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following SkillPort courses: Active Listening in the Workplace (33 mins); Becoming a Great Listener (24 mins); Interacting with Customers (30 mins); note, SkillPort is CAC enabled
Provide a self-reflection regarding key takeaways from the courses with workplace applications
Provide four examples of written documentation that demonstrate the ability to craft a product in accordance with appropriate Air Force Instructions
Submit a sample email displaying proper email etiquette.  (For more info - see Tongue and Quill)
Present legal briefings (e.g., First Term Airmen Center, pre-deployment, statement of duty, newcomer briefings, etc.)
Complete the Paralegal: Communication Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

fb751721-064a-4db8-a305-cece65be75c7.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to strictly adhere to the accepted standards of legal ethics and to the general principles of proper conduct, ensuring the goals of professionalism were adhered to in the performance of their duties by maintaining a high level of personal and professional integrity.
fb751721-064a-4db8-a305-cece65be75c7.name: Paralegal: Ethics Specialist

alignments.name: AIR FORCE INSTRUCTION 51-110
alignments.description: 3.8. Although paralegals and nonlawyer assistants are not licensed attorneys subject to state licensing authorities, all Air Force legal professionals are responsible for knowing and conducting themselves in a manner consistent with the applicable rules and standards that govern the Air Force practice of the attorneys they assist.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Skillport Leading with Values and Ethics course or equivalent (NOTE: SkillPort is CAC enabled)
Complete Ethical Self-Assessment Tool

Provide a statement affirming that a records review was completed to ensure there has been no derogatory information (Unfavorable Information File, Non-Judicial Punishment, Military or Civilian Court Conviction) in the past 12 months

Complete a self-reflection detailing fairness in decision-making, displaying and upholding integrity using ethical concepts, managing professional relationships and exemplifying Judge Advocate General Corps ethical standards (Reference AFI 51-110)
Complete the Paralegal: Ethics Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

7c5bbe75-96e1-4dca-a7f6-5432639c81b6.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to act as an official, unbiased witness to the identity and signature of the person who comes before the notary as well as demonstrated the ability to administer oaths and affirmations.
7c5bbe75-96e1-4dca-a7f6-5432639c81b6.name: Civil Law: Notary Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the locality-required Notary Training (i.e., AF Paralegal Apprentice Course (PAC), State Notary Certification, or equivalent)
Review the Professional Responsibilities and Rules via JAG's FLITE website (NOTE: FLITE is CAC enabled)
Complete an essay describing notary governance and notarial act restrictions
Perform Notarial Acts
Complete the Civil Law: Notary Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

276aeb85-327b-4e04-8759-dc021825026b.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to evaluate courts, documents and evidence requests, and productions. They are able to articulate rules of evidence and document management techniques to a cross-functional team, meet their technical competence and ethical mandate, and lead full legal teams throughout the court process.
276aeb85-327b-4e04-8759-dc021825026b.name: Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Pass three month Air Force Paralegal Apprentice Course or equivalent; and  Pass Air Force Paralegal Craftsman Course or equivalent; and  Complete six years of on the job training in any Legal Office; and Earned the Specialist Badge & Manager Badge; and Served at least five years in Military Justice , with at least two as NCOIC; and Worked a minimum of 20 discovery requests

Provide an essay outlining and including an explanation of at least 20 summaries of discovery responses and/or discovery requests, type of offense(s), outside agency coordination (if applicable), a description of the type of evidence, the information solicited to fulfill the response/request, and a description of the discovery or evidence tracking tool utilized. *Do not discuss ongoing cases, specific individual names or any controlled unclassified information and;
Provide an essay outlining evidence strategy, preparing evidence for trial, and management of the discovery program IAW the Federal or Military Rules of Evidence.
Complete the Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Expert rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

45942667-7f63-45c5-b5a5-287969cc6a94.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to evaluate documents and evidence requests, and productions. They are able to not only understand rules of evidence and document management techniques to meet their technical competence and ethical mandate but also how discovery and evidence plays a larger role in the court process.
45942667-7f63-45c5-b5a5-287969cc6a94.name: Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Manager

badge_template_activities.title: Pass three month Air Force Paralegal Apprentice Course or equivalent;  Must complete three years of on the job training in any Legal Office; and  Must have earned the Specialist Badge or worked at a minimum of 10 discovery requests.

Provide an essay explaining at least ten summaries of discovery responses and/or discovery requests, list the type of offense(s), discuss outside agency coordination (if applicable), provide a description of the type of evidence used, what information was solicited to fulfill the response/request, and provide a description of the discovery or evidence tracking tool utilized.; and
Provide an essay explaining  how you would receive, distribute, and protect discovery from an outside agency, i.e. USACIL.; and

Provide an essay explaining on the benefits of different eDiscovery platforms or electronic discovery software programs such as CaseMap, TimeMap, TextMap, Concordance, iCONECT, VenioOne, Everlaw, DISCO, Cloudnine review, and/or Sanction.
Complete the Military Justice & Discipline: Discovery & Evidence Manager rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

b7c62103-c306-4992-b5c9-e1859f4530c1.description: The earner of this badge graduated from an Environmental Law course and has knowledge and understanding of the duties of an Operations and International Law Paralegal with an Environmental Law focus, enhanced command situational awareness, maximized decision space, and promoted optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.
b7c62103-c306-4992-b5c9-e1859f4530c1.name: Operations & International Law: Environmental Specialist

alignments.name: AFJAGS Environmental Law Basic Course
alignments.description: This course provides attorneys with an ability to comprehend and analyze basic principles and concepts of federal environmental law, major federal environmental statues, regulations, case law, federal policy, and the environmental impact process to help ensure compliance at DoD facilities.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduate from an Environmental Law course (recommended course listed below)
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

c5a4f627-23b3-4ae3-8d3d-188f1ef0746a.description: The earner of this badge conducted a compliance evaluation of all legal domains within a work center, utilized regulatory and statutory references, used approved grading methodology to identify compliant/deficient items are areas of recommended improvement, and drafted a summary of findings. The Earner demonstrated competency in critical thinking, analysis, substantiation collection and review, process improvement, and demonstrated proficiency in legal written communication.
c5a4f627-23b3-4ae3-8d3d-188f1ef0746a.name: Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Expert

alignments.name: AFI 51-109, The Article 6 Inspection Process
alignments.description: 1.3.10.2. Conduct self-assessments every six (6) months. (T-2) 1.3.10.3. Satisfy all pre-inspection requirements consistent with this instruction and AFI 90-201. (T-2)

badge_template_activities.title: Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Specialist
Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Manager
Conduct a compliance evaluation of all legal domains within a work center
Apply approved grading methodology to identify compliant/deficient items and Areas of Recommended Improvement
Draft a written summary of findings, to include lessons learned
Secure Senior Supervisory Attorney (SJA) and Law Office Superintendent endorsement
Complete the Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Expert rubric
The Earner's Numbered Air Force or MAJCOM Functional Manager will review the Rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

505b14c0-d448-4206-b01f-5022709c48f5.description: The earner of this badge conducted a compliance evaluation of a legal domain within a work center, utilized appropriate resources and statutory references, summarized findings, and developed a Corrective Action Plan for an identified deficiency or Recommended Improvement Area. The Earner demonstrated competency in critical thinking, analysis, substantiation collection and review, process improvement, and utilized legal research skills to demonstrate proficiency in legal written communication.
505b14c0-d448-4206-b01f-5022709c48f5.name: Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Manager

alignments.name: AFI 51-109, The Article 6 Inspection Process
alignments.description: 1.3.10.2. Conduct self-assessments every six (6) months. (T-2) 1.3.10.3. Satisfy all pre-inspection requirements consistent with this instruction and AFI 90-201. (T-2)

badge_template_activities.title: Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Specialist
Conduct a compliance evaluation of a legal domain within the work center
Draft a written summary of findings, including lessons learned
Develop a Corrective Action Plan to address one identified deficiency or Recommended Improvement Area
Secure Senior Supervisory Attorney (SJA) and Law Office Superintendent (LOS) endorsement
Complete the Paralegal Leadership: Compliance Manager rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

cbb83dd9-c76b-408a-ab5d-ac522e9e21cb.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to identify the purpose, roles and responsibilities, and possible Line of Duty determination categories, as outlined in Air Force (AF) Form 348, Line of Duty (LOD) Determinations. The Earner completed Line of Duty determination legal reviews, in accordance with Air Force Instruction 36-2910, Line of Duty Determination, Medical Continuation, and Incapacitation Pay, and demonstrated advanced knowledge and application of the process.
cbb83dd9-c76b-408a-ab5d-ac522e9e21cb.name: Civil Law: Line of Duty Specialist

alignments.name: AFI 36-2910
alignments.description: Air Force Instruction - Line of Duty Determinations

badge_template_activities.title: Complete six months Civil Law On the Job Training
Complete at least three Line of Duty determinations.
Complete an essay describing the roles and responsibilities during a Line of Duty determination
Pass the Line of Duty determination knowledge quiz
Complete the Civil Law: Line of Duty Specialist rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
For additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet

skills.name: Ability To Differenciate Between Misconduct And Negligence
Ability To Guide Others Through A Process
Basic Knowledge Of Line Of Duty (LOD) Concepts
Basic Knowledge Of Line Of Duty (LOD) Process

f7d8fdc3-f8c2-442c-a028-b379c60e7804.description: The earner of this badge graduated from a Cyberspace and Information Law course and performed the duties of an Operations and International Law Paralegal with a Cyberspace and Information Law focus, enhanced command situational awareness, maximized decision space, and promoted optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.
f7d8fdc3-f8c2-442c-a028-b379c60e7804.name: Operations & International Law: Cyberspace & Information Manager

alignments.name: AFJAGS Cyber Law Basic Course
alignments.description: This course introduces DoD legal professionals to DoD operations in the cyberspace domain with a focus on the domestic and international rules that govern those operations.

alignments.name: JKO JFC 100 Cyberspace Operations Awareness
alignments.description: The purpose of this course is to introduce staff to various facets of cyberspace operations to include: key terms, fundamental policies, guidance, and authorities required to lawfully conduct cyberspace operations.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduate from a Cyberspace/Information Law course (recommended courses listed below)
Document key takeaways and workplace applications from course material
Perform the duties of an Operations Law Paralegal
Provide a self-reflection that aligns Operations Law Paralegal professional experience with Mission Authority, Fiscal Authority, and Commander’s Intent as related to mission accomplishment
Complete the Operations & International Law: Cyberspace & Information Manager rubric
The Earner's supervisor will review the rubric and recommend the Earner for award of the badge
Click here for additional information regarding the USAF Paralegals' digital badge initiative and the earning process.

198e9c73-50c3-4dad-9e3d-e96cce8b73fe.description: The earner of this badge graduated from a Cyberspace and Information Law course and has knowledge and understanding of the duties of an Operations and International Law Paralegal with a Cyberspace and Information Law focus, enhanced command situational awareness, maximized decision space, and promoted optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.

6256a47c-f9c8-44ce-ba03-80a32bc3d1aa.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated a wide depth and breadth of experience and professionalism in the Operations and International Law environment by enhancing command situational awareness, maximizing decision space, and promoting optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.
6256a47c-f9c8-44ce-ba03-80a32bc3d1aa.name: Operations & International Law Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Operations & International Law: Operations Manager
In addition to the Ops & Int'l Law Manager: Operations badge, the Earner must complete one of the following USAF Paralegal digital badges
Operations & International Law: Cyberspace & Information Manager
Operations & International Law: Environmental Manager
Operations & International Law: (G)AIB Recorder Manager

abb3a8c4-f4d6-4c12-acb2-4f814a7286c6.description: The earner of this badge graduated from an Operations Law course and performed the duties of an Operations Law Paralegal in a variety of environments that enhance command situational awareness, maximize decision space, and promote optimal conditions for the projection of ready forces for mission accomplishment.
